4d3366ccad6031dbdf9c7cb016da6ba0 (02:01): Buse can be a last name in Germany, and quite a few companies make up "first letter of firstname.lastname" email adresses, now i wonder if that ever caused trouble :P
9ae65d634d1f8e7131d620c271cc2704 (02:03): lol mined failed like 20 things
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:06): how can I find the physical location of an IP address?
1e2bafed5050e07132cd7377a6bd4684 (02:06): google visual ip tracer
1e2bafed5050e07132cd7377a6bd4684 (02:07): its the first link
1e2bafed5050e07132cd7377a6bd4684 (02:07): visualroute.com or something
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:07): http://www.hostip.info/
1e2bafed5050e07132cd7377a6bd4684 (02:07): or http://visualroute.visualware.com/
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:07): easier to use hostip - nothing to install
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:08): visualroute is nice, but (imho) for other reasons
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:08): I didn't need a magical picture, I just wanted to make sure that this IP was legitimate
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:09): a computer on my network is saturating the T1, I wanted to make sure it's for a business reason, not some filesharing shit
f7f5ab7651d32ce260d7ba5082d6cf83 (02:12): hrrrm whos job is it to mount keyboard trays that require powertools?
e35295a96392ca74daea05eb905c6444 (02:16): does sb know a source for a binary-download of ssldump for windows?
de2d3cdd37090dc268a063156ff40eef (02:17): anyone in here/
7406d578e7cc98e0304ba817da1df79b (02:21): anyone ever used metasploit?
7406d578e7cc98e0304ba817da1df79b (02:23): http://www.metasploit.com/
7c0c7e318e2a2a1d124eafbbf465a53b (02:24): does anyone konw how to run vmware server as a windows service so that my virtual machines don't turn off when I logoff?
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:25): Plouj, in the vmware properties, you need to change it so that it runs as System user, not you
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:25): does anyone here have a wrt54g that they can look at and tell me how many mA it draws?
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:26): Plouj, I don't remember how I did that though
7c0c7e318e2a2a1d124eafbbf465a53b (02:26): frb-work: ah, found it
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:26): I'm looking for a power supply I can use to only sustain the active wireless router and cable modem during outages, not any computer systems
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:27): however I dont know how much capacity I'd need to run for x minutes
7c0c7e318e2a2a1d124eafbbf465a53b (02:27): great!
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:27): Plouj, be warned, after youdo that, you need to change your VMWare console shortcuts to run as Admin, or you won't be able to modify its settings
7c0c7e318e2a2a1d124eafbbf465a53b (02:28): frb-work: how would I change that?
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:28): Plouj, it should be in the properties of the shortcut
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:28): I don't know if XP Home can do it though
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:29): you can also set the vm to not be private, that should work too
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:29): Plouj, for more help, try #vmware, they are cool
f32354e3c547cbf019481df70a3f2529 (02:30): Silivrenion: sure hold on
13860a12a95325377fd566a38b1be13b (02:34): Silivrenion: yes

c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:35): its absolutely unrealistic to imagine powering my server during power outages, with its 7 cooling fans, 6 scsi hard drives, dual redundant power supplies, and dual processors
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:35): that's all?
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:36): i figure its a lot more practical to sustain the access point instead, because laptops will probably still work
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:36): dude, they make UPSs for entire office floors
13860a12a95325377fd566a38b1be13b (02:36): Silivrenion: you need a generator.
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:36): they make UPSs for mainframes, surely they make something for your system
300081ef861668f454edd985c0d06596 (02:36): you could just take some time off of the computer lol
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:36): LeeJunFan, both
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:36): ... and that's wildly expensive to implement, especially if you want more than 10 minutes of power
13860a12a95325377fd566a38b1be13b (02:36): or take some fans off.
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:36): you need a UPS to keep it up long enough for the generator to kick in
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:37): i'm wondering how long a small ups will sustain 1-1.5 amps, 120v
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:38): When thinking datacenter power, one quickly finds out that server power is only half the battle. If you can't cool the DC, the DC is dead.
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:38): quux, but the cooling system can drop for 3-5 minutes while the generators start
e35295a96392ca74daea05eb905c6444 (02:39): does sb know a source for a binary-download of ssldump for windows?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:39): frb-work, all that sounds simple but trust me on this, getting redundant power up & running is a seriously hairpulling task
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:40): cooling isnt necessarily a problem
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:40): drawing graphs is a hairpulling task :)
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:40): its only the router and modem
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:41): you know, how long will a 500VA UPS last with 1-1.5A draw at 120V?
9ae65d634d1f8e7131d620c271cc2704 (02:41): you expect someone to just know that?
77a0088b192815bdb2c93d01675b706a (02:42): how long with 1000VA last with an LCD/computer? ;)
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:43): It's a pretty simple calculation
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:44): 1.5 amps x 120 volts = 180va
006239103e64ac399d1426badcb17926 (02:44): is that the same for wattiage?
006239103e64ac399d1426badcb17926 (02:44): amps X volts = watts?
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:45): so how long is that consumption rate?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:45): 500va / 180va= 2.78 load factor
de5057fbbac6623965fe11701309c7fb (02:45): Thus, you can figure that at 100VA draw, you'd get ten times longer uptime than with a 1000VZ draw.
c7ed5d3900e029ca99827ce778a7a377 (02:46): its 180VA per what amount of time?
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:46): err, load ratio
d9f91a7cc2d380c3ee153bcbf594d403 (02:46): Silivrenion: maybe we should hum.. do .. hum.. do
de5057fbbac6623965fe11701309c7fb (02:46): And IIRC the manufacturer tells you what uptime you'd expect at what capacity.
006239103e64ac399d1426badcb17926 (02:47): what happened eariler with a gloabl notice?

5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:47): So. Now you look at your 500VA UPS and see what its designed runtime at full load is, multiply that by the load ratio, and viola! You have a good estimate of runtime at your load

006239103e64ac399d1426badcb17926 (02:48): yeah thats not needed in a global notice
9ae65d634d1f8e7131d620c271cc2704 (02:48): I have always used the unit of VA in a different sense
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:49): AustLaw`, what sense?
9ae65d634d1f8e7131d620c271cc2704 (02:50): the reative power of a circuit
9ae65d634d1f8e7131d620c271cc2704 (02:50): well, reative power
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:50): Erm, that goes a little past Ohms law which is as far as I went
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:51): Anyway volt-amperes is the standard rating of a UPS
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:53): The numbers you need from the UPS are: VA, and load backup time
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:53): err, 'full load backup time'
